solution_line_template: Julian's number of friends who are girls is {julian_girls_percent}*{julian_total_friends} = <<{julian_girls_percent}*{julian_total_friends}={julian_girls_friends}>>{julian_girls_friends}

Boyd has twice as many friends as Julian who are girls, a total of {boyd_girls_multiplier}*{julian_girls_friends} = <<{boyd_girls_multiplier}*{julian_girls_friends}={boyd_girls_friends}>>{boyd_girls_friends}
If Boyd has {boyd_total_friends} friends, he has {boyd_total_friends}-{boyd_girls_friends} = <<{boyd_total_friends}-{boyd_girls_friends}={boyd_boys_friends}>>{boyd_boys_friends} boys

The percentage of boys in Boyd's Facebook friends is {boyd_boys_friends}/{boyd_total_friends}*{percentage_multiplier} = <<{boyd_boys_friends}/{boyd_total_friends}*{percentage_multiplier}={boyd_boys_percentage}>>{boyd_boys_percentage}
